column1: swing. But too much. And not very well directed. Full and swinging well down leg for a leg side wide.
wow, that was a bad shot. It was full and straight, swinging back in, but Zaman throws his hands at the ball, looking to hit the ball too hard through cover. Inside-edged into the pad.
on the pads this time, 133 kph, hits Zaman's pad en route to square leg
136 kph, good length delivery outside off, defended into the cover region. The bat well away from the pad
good length delivery outside off, 131 kph, nicely bowled. A choppy drive into the ground towards cover
nice change-up. Goes full and straight this time, fullish length, defended back
good end from Lakmal. Full and straight, 134 kph, Shehzad hits the ball back to the bowler with a nice, straight bat face. Variable swing in that over
on a length around middle, fantastic line, no width and Zaman is forced to defend from the crease
some away shape. Pushed through fuller too, full and wide, bunted away to cover from the crease
a low full toss around off, skewed away to midwicket
a bit of width, full outside off. Zaman tries to hit that too hard again, as a result the ball is mis-timed back to the bowler

squeezed away for runs. Nowhere near control. Fullish around middle and leg, Zaman tries to hit that straight but the hands are clutching the bat too hard, the ball skews off the inside half through square leg. Zaman trying to hit every ball too hard
much better. That's a good delivery, on a length around middle and leg, pushed to mid-on and Zaman calls his partner through. Quality single
lays into that. The bat comes down at the right angle, and the timing is great. Full delivery outside off, Zaman drives through cover, and finds the gap. Didn't over-hit that
drifts down leg for another leg-side wide
change in pace, a slower delivery on leg, defended towards mid-on.
full, but drifting down leg, off the pad towards fine leg for a leg bye
still no run for Shehzad. Full and wide outside off, the ball moving away, driven through to cover.
there is his first run! Full outside off, moving away, driven to extra cover, where the fielder dives to his right and saves some runs

that will run away. 131 kph, a full delivery on off, Zaman offers the full face of the bat and just times his on-drive. Lakmal reaches out, but even though his reach is long, the timing is too good. Beats the bowler, Shehzad and mid-on.
fullish delivery outside off, swinging away. Badly-timed drive finds short cover
whips this through square leg for a run. On a length, but this one seams back in. Read the length and direction of swing and played the right stroke

edged and gone! Beauty from Gamage. On a length from Gamage, but the ball moves away, like it has been doing for him through this spell. Zaman opts for the wrong stroke - trying to whip the ball into the leg side, against the angle of swing. What that generally means is the batsman will be squared up if there is substantial movement, and there is. A thick outside edge carries at head height to a wide slip. Fantastic bowling, but could have been played better
full delivery outside off, a solid defensive block, watchfully played
good length outside off, the ball coming back in, worked into the leg side, towards midwicket
fantastic over, probing. 132 kph, full delivery outside off, the ball coming back in, defended
fullish delivery on off, 133 kph, played away towards mid-on. Trying to use his wrists to find a gap, proactive but ineffective

lovely shot, but straight to the fielder. However good you look playing a stroke, however good your timing is, it's all pretty much useless without the second requisite of boundary-scoring, placement. Shehzad nails his languid cover drive to extra cover
adjusts his length right away, on a length around off, defended back
a slower ball outside off, 125 kph, whipped to wide mid-on for one. There's a gap there, Shehzad wanted more power into the stroke.
full delivery outside off, the ball holds its line, defended back
full delivery outside off, 127 kph, driven into the mid-off region
full delivery outside off, 83 mph, carved to wide third man for a couple. Beat point, opened the bat face late.
smashed! But straight to third man. Full and wide outside off, a hammered cut to third man
good length delivery outside off, driven towards mid-off
shortish delivery outside off, 129 kph, may or may not have been short enough to pull, but Babar goes through with the stroke, pulled to mid-on
lovely shot. Full and very wide outside off, Babar nails his drive, into the gap at extra cover. Good-enough timing
full delivery outside off, 130 kph, blocked
shortish delivery on off, Shehzad flicks this to fine leg, a whippy clip. Down to fine leg for a couple
full around off, the ball coming back in, worked away to wide mid-on for one

133 kph, that's a poor shot. Shehzad's dire form continues. It's full and wide outside off. Wide enough for him to drive, but he needed to be more compact to ensure he was in control. He loosely throws his hands at it, gets it off the outside half of the bat and straight to backward point. Not a great delivery, not a great shot.
shortish and wide outside off, chopped away towards cover from the crease
good length outside off, 130 kph, punched away back towards mid-off. Sri Lanka's bowlers have been great this afternoon
terrific end. Full delivery on a fifth-stump line, defended into the cover region
full delivery on off, the ball coming back in, driven with the angle of swing, to mid-on
good length delivery outside off, punched towards cover
on a length outside off, a blocked push to mid-off. The line and length is quite good

124 kph, the pace has gone down slightly, but not the accuracy. On a length on off, defended back. Can't score of that, unless you whip your wrists through the line, and get one to square leg, like how Hashim Amla does
this is really good stuff from Sri Lanka. Shortish delivery outside off, punched into the ground towards short point, who leaps up to parry the ball away. That was four if the ball beat him
just one off the over. Fullish delivery, angling back in, towards off or just outside. Played into the midwicket region
full delivery outside off, 136 kph, driven straight to short cover. Another dot, racking up quickly
full delivery outside off, 134 kph, the ball moves away late, a thick outside edge down to third man. Not in control again
full delivery outside off, 139 kph, Hafeez drives languidly to mid-off
a good stop again. Full outside off, 85 mph, Hafeez's drive skews off the outside half towards point, who dives to his right to save a couple
132 kph, shortish delivery outside off, Babar is slightly late on his drive, the ball takes the under-edge to the keeper.
and another dot. 138 kph, short and wide outside off, carved away towards point. Babar is now 6 on 18
shortish delivery on leg, worked down to fine leg for one, via the pad

that's a fine stroke. On middle and leg, on a length, worked away through midwicket. A whippy flick. Babar loses his bat towards the completion of the second run, but keeps his head and calmly comes back for three
fullish and wide outside off, 133 kph, left alone
full delivery outside off, 129 kph, played back towards mid-on
runs down the pitch, gets there and just goes through with his clean swing. Not over-hit, not caressed, somewhere in between. Hits the ball over the bowler's head and it clears the mid-off boundary

128 kph, edged and gone. Gamage is fired up. That's some response. On a length outside off, hafeez has been standing on off, so even though it's a sixth. maybe seventh-stump channel, Hafeez feels he has to play, a nothing prod. And then the magic, late, late away movement creates a thick outside edge which is easily taken by the keeper.
goes wide of the crease, full outside off, Babar is watchful in defense
short and wide, was there to be cut, but Babar's flaying slash finds point
full outside off, 132 kph, a solid block into the mid-off region
that's a nice stroke but a good fielding position in place to protect the over. Full and wide, driven through to deep point
good length outside off, 137 kph, defended back
128 kph, digs this one in on middle and leg. Malik gets underneath it
124 kph short on middle and leg, Babar this time gets underneath the bouncer
good length delivery outside off, pushed out towards mid-off. Another dot. Currently, the intent is not even there to hit a gap
well down leg for an extra. A great delivery to a left-hander
that's a great stroke. He hasn't been flustered by the dots, even though maybe he should be. Good length delivery on middle and leg, punched away to the mid-on boundary. Just timing
good length outside off, hit away through deep cover for a couple. Good running from Malik to come back
slightly short outside off, pulled away to wide mid-on. Probably the wrong choice of shot, but it's not too quick
fullish and wide outside off, left alone. Just inside the tramline.
a low full toss outside off, Malik almost bunted that right back. Lands in front of and to the left of a diving Vandersay for one to long-off
short and wide, smashed to the sweeper cover off the back foot
nicely tossed up outside off, Malik leans forward and drives to the sweeper cover, nicely played
this is quicker and straighter, full, defended into the mid-off region
lovely shot. Slightly short and wide, short enough for Babar to pick the length early, goes back and carves a cut through the vacant point region. Perfect placement too
slightly leg side-ish, on middle and leg, clipped down to short fine leg
129 kph, digs this one in on off, Malik gets on top of the bounce to defend, keeps it down
131 kph, another short delivery on off, Malik plays it nicely, down by his feet, wants one but it's too close to the bowler
fullish delivery outside off, 134 kph, seam movement back in, defended
short and wide, a hit-me delivery. It's smashed, but straight to the sweeper cover
fullish delivery around off, worked wide of mid-on for a quick single, good run
135 kph, short delivery on middle and leg, nudged away to deep square leg, nice use of the wrists
flight outside off, 84 kph, driven to the sweeper cover for one. Hitting the ball with the spin
quick outside off, 87 kph, nice line, defended into the off side
shortish and wide outside off, cut to the sweeper cover, read the length early and went back
oh wow. That's the shot of the day. It's short, it's quick and slightly wide. Malik somehow goes back enough, creates room by bending his knees and carves the cut between point and third man. Shot.
the googly, on middle and leg, worked to square leg for one
83 kph, quick on middle, driven to long-on. And that will be drinks.
back of a length, slight shape in at off stump. Gets tall to punch this to mid-on
full and wide outside off stump. Doesn't come on to the bat as he looks to lean into the cover drive. He dabs it back down the pitch
good length at off stump, on the back foot to punch towards mid-on. Midwicket leaps to his left to stop it
121 kph, full outside off stump, mistimes the cover drive again. This time it's straight at extra cover
136 kph, back of a length at off stump, this hurries onto him and he gets under the pull shot. Scoops it over midwicket and to deep square's left
good length at middle stump, stands in the crease and taps it to long-on
tossed up outside off stump, gets to the pitch and drives but can't beat extra cover's dive
good length, drifting in from wide outside off, pushed back down the pitch off the inside half of the bat
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot
back of a length outside off stump, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
full outside off stump, driven to extra cover
full at off stump, drifts in and is a little quicker. Hurriedly arches to drive this inside-out

gone! Guides it straight to the keeper. Oh Malik surely knows that's the not the shot on this kind of a surface, but he can only think about as he walks back. This is back of a length in the corridor, he waits a long time for it to come on and opens the face. Wasn't enough room or pace for that shot. It's a feeble dab in the end and a simple one for Dickwella
back of a length, wide outside off stump, tapped on the up to point
back of a length at off stump, punched back to the bowler
beaten. Floats this wide outside off stump, gets it to bend away and nips past the attempted cover drive
good length at off stump, tapped to extra cover
good length, wide outside off. Reaches out and opens the face as this doesn't come on. Slices to third man
tossed up at off stump, flicked to midwicket's right
tossed up. Nice juicy full toss outside off. Drills it straight to extra cover who doesn't gather it
tossed up at off stump, driven to long-off
full one, drifting in at middle stump. Makes room and drives with the spin to long-off
tossed up at middle stump, met on the full and flicked straight to midwicket
googly. Zips off a length as he looks to flick. Inside edge onto pad
good length at off stump shuffles across and watchfully dabs this to deep square
good length at off stump, pushed to mid-on on the up
back of a length at off stump. Looks to dab it into the off side with soft hands, but point is agile
full at middle stump, driven to mid-on
full at middle stump, pushes it past the non-striker...and mid-on misfields after lunging to his left. Allows the second run

drags it on! Thisara Perera is making wonderful use of this slow surface. Floats another one up wide outside off stump. It's 123 kph. Sarfraz goes with hard hands, way away from his body and gets a big inside edge. The front foot wasn't close to the ball and the gap was huge. Another poor shot
back of a length, spinning into middle stump. Flicked off the back foot to deep square
good length at middle stump, defended off the front foot
length at leg stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up nicely at leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the inside half of the bat
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
good length, middle stump, dead-batted into the off side
good length at off stump, pushed off the inside half past midwicket
good length, angled across the corridor. Defended down the pitch
good length, slanted across off stump. Looks to slash at it. Beaten. Drops in front of the keeper
back of a length, angled across the channel. Defended to point off the outside edge
back of a length, in the corridor, dabs it to third man
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to long-on off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, flicked to midwicket
good length at off stump, pushes into the off side and takes off. Imad sends him back. Good call.
good length outside off, defended down the pitch off the front foot
tossed up at off stump, steps out and clips it stylishly. But midwicket leaps to his left to stop that
good length at middle stump, tickled through square leg off the front foot
googly. He's been bowling off spin so far. Switches to wrist spin and the first one is a wrong'un. Defended to point off the back foot
good length at middle stump, tapped to midwicket's left
back of a length at off stump, punched back to the bowler on the up
good length outside off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length at middle stump, punched to mid-on from the crease
good length at off stump, pushed to mid-off on the up
good length at middle stump, pushed through midwicket with soft hands
good length at middle stump. Defended into the off side
edge falls short of first slip. Good length ball, pushed at with soft hands
full at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
googly. Short and wide outside off. Hammered off the back foot, straight to sweeper cover
back of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on
good length at off stump, poked through the covers off the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, steps out and taps it to point
back of a length at off stump, closes the face and bunts it through the open square leg region
good length, slanted in at middle stump. Shuffles and flicks to deep square
back of a length outside off stump, poked through the covers on the up
good length at off stump, whipped to deep square leg
back of a length at middle stump, flicked to deep square
back of a length at off stump, pushed through the covers off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, mistimed drive straight to mid-off
legspin, flicked off the pads to deep square leg
another legspiner. Back of a length at off stump, punched with the turn to sweeper's right
tossed up at off stump, driven to long-off
good length at off stump, waits for it to come on uses his wrists to poke it through square leg
back of a length at leg stump, pushed to short fine leg's left
tossed up full and wide, jams the drive into the turf and at extra cover. He dives to his left and pushes this back towards the bowler

big appeal for lbw. It was turned down. And Sri Lanka have reviewed. He was looking to drive this through the off side, but wasn't to the pitch. Seemed like he was playing for a googly, but this turns back in and smashes into the front pad...there is no bat. The only thing to save him here is line of impact. It was close to being outside off stump. But we'll wait for tracking...impact in line. Wickets hitting. Decision overturned. Imad is gone. A good review from Tharanga. That looked liked it hit him outside off at full speed, but the replays show just how little his front leg had moved. Trapped right in front.
good length at middle stump, inside edge as he looks to defend. Trickles through square leg
good length at middle stump, spins away and and he can't wrap his wrists around it with enough force
tossed up at leg stump, punched back down the pitch
googly not picked. Gingerly goes on to the back foot and pokes at it with a big gap
googly, back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
tossed up at middle stump, driven back at the bowler
leg break, back of a length outside off, backs away and slices it through point
off break, back of a length at middle stump. Nudged through square leg off the back foot
legbreak, tossed up at off stump. Tapped straight to midwicket
good length at off stump, hurries him on the back foot but he watches it closely and turns it into the leg side
slider, back of a length at midlde stump. Hurriedly punched to extra cover
full toss outside off, jams it into the floor, straight to extra cover
full outside off stump, poked wide of extra cover
good length at off stump, solidly defended on the front foot
full at leg stump, pushed through square leg
short one outside off, backs way and goes too hard at it. Hits it to extra cover with no timing
good length at middle stump, turned through square leg with soft hands
back of a length outside off stump, spins back sharply and he only just gets bat to keep this out
legbreak, back of a length at midlde stump, rips away towards the off side. Gingerly poked with no feet
tossed up at middle stump, pushed back at the bowler
tossed up at middle stump and this time he gets down nicely and paddles this fine
tossed up at off stump, sliced past point
tossed up at off stump, closes the face too early on the flick. Leading edge dribbles to extra cover
good length at off stump, pushed into the off side
slider, length at off stump. Hurries him and he gets an under-edge as he tries to stab this through covers off the back foot
good length at middle stump, watches it on and flicks to long-on to bring up his seventh fifty. Yet again, Babar Azam has been miles above his peers in an ODI
googly, backs away and slices this length ball to point off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, flicked to long-on
tossed up outside off, reaches out for it and pokes to long-on
full at leg stump, overly cautious as he looks to flick with soft hands. Can't beat midwicket
good length at middle stump, flicked to long-on
back of a length at off stump, goes on the back foot but flicks onto his pads and into the midwicket region
back of a length down leg side, cops it on the pads as he looks to glance it fine
dropped short at leg stump and he's quickly onto it, because he knows the field - there's no one deep at long leg. Waits for it to come on and plays a subdued pull, places it past short fine leg
tossed up at off stump, driven firmly to sweeper cover

oh how has he survived that. A flipper, it's full at off stump and for some reason, he's on the back foot and backing away at this. Manages to get bat on it at the last moment and protect his exposed stumps
good length at off stump, pushed to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, nudged through point with an open face
good length at middle stump, stretches forward and drops it in front of midwicket with soft hands to steal a single
back of a length outside off stump, stands tall and whips it to deep square
good length at middle stump, poked wide of mid-on
good length at off stump, pushed to midwicket with a closed face
back of a length at off stump, shuffles and glances this off his hips to deep square
short one outside off, leaps to get on top of the bounce and tap this through the open midwicket region
inswinging yorker at his front toe. Manages to jam it out to midwicket
that's tripe. A high full toss outside off and Babar nails his cover drive, to the left of cover. Not a good ball.
the googly on off, nudged towards square leg for a tight, easy run.
nicely tossed up on off, driven with the spin to long-off
a tad too short, Babar rushes back, picks the length and cuts to the sweeper cover
well run, the googly on leg, clipped away towards short fine leg for one more.
flight outside off, driven with the spin to cover. Tidy over for Pakistan
excellent single. Good length around off, tapped towards silly point and Babar responds positively.
full delivery outside off, 132 kph, movement back in, driven to cover from the crease
looking for that yorker. Full on middle and leg, nudged through to square leg for one
good stop from point. A slower, wide delivery. Babar reaches out and slices a drive towards point, who dives to his right and saves a couple at least
change in length. Goes short and wide outside off, Shadab bails out of an upper cut.
a slower ball around off, worked away to midwicket from the crease.
flat on middle, 86 kph, worked to deep midwicket for one
on the pads again, worked away to deep square leg for one. Doing it nicely
slow and straight, 87 kph, a nudge to deep midwicket for a run. Three easy singles.
short and quick, Shadab goes back and works the ball to midwicket
pushed through again, on middle, clipped to midwicket
good end. Quicker on the pads, Shadab tries to turn the ball into the leg side, but can only bunt the ball back
full delivery outside off, 120 kph. Babar drives nicely but finds the fielder at cover
checked drive, but just short of cover. A slow delivery outside off, Babar is slightly early on his drive, chipped towards Chandimal, but the ball lands safely
full and straight, another slow delivery, 113 kph, driven back to the bowler, the ball may or may not have hit Thisara's finger, but it hit the stumps at the bowler's end. The batsman was safe anyway
shortish and wide outside off, tapped to cover from the crease
five dot balls, 115 kph, five slower balls. Babar's timing has been thrown off, sliced to point
117 kph, on a length around off, bunted to long-on from the crease. Just one off the over. Fine bowling
short outside off, Babar hurries back and cuts to the sweeper cover for one
slow on the pads, 81 kph, Shadab misses a flick. Struck on the pad
lovely shot. Inside-out over cover for a couple. It was full on off, enabling him to get underneath the length. Long-off cleans up
smashes this. Quick down leg, swept away towards deep backward square leg for a couple. The fielder runs around to his right to save the boundary
tip and run towards cover. Nice, soft hands
full on off, 82 kph, nurdled away to square leg.
good length delivery outside off, dabbed down towards third man for a couple. 50 partnership between these two as well
127 kph, good length outside off, just patted away towards cover for a tight run
123 kph, fullish around off, flicked down to long-on for one
terrific line. 127 kph, full around off, played back towards the bowler
a shortish slower delivery outside off, pushed towards short cover who fumbles while collecting
121 kph, good length outside off, smashed away towards the sweeper cover for one.
short and wide to start from Gamage. Shadab hurries down and swings through the line, but the ball moves away slightly, takes the under edge towards third man
good length outside off, 128 kph, drilled through cover for one
full and wide outside off, 125 kph, moving away late, scythed through to the sweeper cover
full and very wide outside off, 135 kph, Babar reaches out and chops to cover. Would have been wide had he not got bat on it
fine stop from cover. Full toss outside off, driven towards Tharanga's left at cover. He dives away to his left and saves some runs, can't stop one though
ooh, the risk-reward ratio was high. Full outside off, Shadab gets low and scoops the ball over short fine leg for two. Plenty of risk for just two.
the legbreak outside off, a fine paddle sweep towards fine leg for a couple. That was almost riskless, well played
short and wide outside off, 81 kph, Babar goes back and nails a cut that finds cover
darted in on middle and leg, driven with the spin to long-on
85 kph, plenty of flight down leg, Shadab got his bat down very late, and went through him. The keeper was unsighted and couldn't collect cleanly. A very tough stumping chance
a soft-hands nurdle through square leg for a couple. Nicely played. Found the gap, and hit it well
86 kph, Babar runs to the pitch and works the ball to midwicket
just short of cover. Short and wide outside off, 130 kph, smashed towards cover, lands in front. Wanted to hit that over mid-off, not enough elevation
full and wide, Babar creams a square drive past point. The sweeper cover fielder has to get across

on a length around off and middle, Babar shuffles across and clips this straight to short fine leg. Wanted to find the gap to the right of short fine leg, may have been better suited trying to hit it to his left
full and straight, going death bowling now. Shadab stays in his crease and powers a drive to long-on

finds the gap somehow. Looked like it was straight down long-on's throat. Full around middle and off, Babar knew long-on was in a few feet, so he hit it straight but wide of long-on's left. That's good batting
driven into the off side for one to retain strike
short down leg, nudged to deep square leg. Gets to 90
a misfield. Naughty, costs them one. Shortish and wide, slapped towards cover, who dives to his left, and lets the ball go through
the offbreak outside off, Shadab gets forward and defends, but no run there
flat on off, Shadab runs down and whips the ball over midwicket for a run. Just one to long-on
95 kph, a clip towards midwicket for one
77 kph, the conventional sweep towards short fine leg. Tidy over from Dananjaya
98 kph, wow, that loooked cloooose. A slower, drifty delivery on leg, the ball takes the inside edge onto the pad. A big appeal from Thisara is struck down
fantastic batting. A short slow ball on off, just bunted into the midwicket region with the only intention of getting two. Babar races back.
a slower delivery around off, 105 kph, driven back to the bowler. Fantastic bowling. A wobbly slower delivery
a slow yorker down leg, dug out by his feet. Another simple single
114 kph, short and slow down leg, worked to midwicket, who dives to his right and parries the ball away
short on middle and off, Shadab backs away and carves his drive to cover. Just the one again.
a fine yorker on middle, 130 kph. Shadab backs away and slices a drive to point
full down leg, 132 kph, flicked to deep midwicket for one more. Pakistan need more than singles now
looking for that scoop towards fine leg. Short outside off, Shadab gets across and flicks to fine leg
another well-executed yorker. Babar feigns a back-away, but holds his ground and taps this to cover
another good yorker. Great bowling. On leg, and Shadab jams this out through his feet for one to square leg
a slower delivery on middle and leg, flicked into the gap at midwicket for two more. Babar moves to 97. Another drink comes out for him
a full, slower delivery on middle. Shovelled to long-on for one. Could not get underneath the length of that
another slower delivery outside off, pushed to long-on, labouring towards his 100 now
looks for the scoop again, no connection. It's a 125 kph yorker outside off, no bat, dot
that's well played. A full toss outside off, sliced away past point for a couple. Deep cover gets around
a slow, floaty delivery outside off, 96 kph, Shadab tries to whack this over midwicket but no connection again. Thisara forcing the batsmen to make their own pace
another slower delivery, 72 mph on off, heaved away to deep midwicket and Pakistan get to 200
another yorker, 132 kph, carved to point for one. 100 partnership between these two, have given Pakistan a chance

there it is. A second consecutive ton for Babar Azam. Takes off his helmet, catches his breath and raises his bat. A short, slow delivery on off, nudged into the gap at midwicket for two. Fine, fine effort
backs well away to try and open up the off side, but Lakmal follows him, on the pads and then off it, one leg bye
in the gap and four. 141 kph, full delivery on leg, in the wheelhouse and Shadab swings, finds the gap at midwicket for four. Lands just inside the boundary
a terrific yorker on middle, all Shadab can do is push to long-off for one. His maiden ODI fifty.
looking foe the yorker, on the pads, clipped away towards backward square leg. Babar may have come back for two had it been the second over of the innings. It's not. Just one
a low full toss outside off, Babar stays in his crease and heaves the ball away, but finds long-on. Long boundaries, not easy to clear these boundaries. End of a fine innings. A tired shot.
a short delivery on leg, a mis-timed pull lobs towards mid-on. Chandimal runs around from mid-off, just one
wheee, where has this guy been? First-ball six. A short delivery on leg, Hasan swings and gets so much power behind it. Way over square leg, massive boundaries these

just short of deep midwicket, for two, plus one? A full toss on middle and leg, Hasan doesn't get enough connection behind it, lands short of the fielder, who picks up and throws the stumps down at the batsman's end. There is an overthrow, but it won't matter because the throw has caught Hasan an inch short. Superb fielding. Saves his side one, Dananjaya the fielder.

taken at deep midwicket, but is it over waist height? A high full toss on leg, Raees swings again, but there is not enough power to clear the fielder at deep midwicket. Dananjaya runs to his right and takes a good, sharp catch. They are never easy to take. The ball is just below waist height
a short delivery on middle, pummeled to long-on for one. The fielder picked up nicely and returned a quick throw to the keeper.
back of a length, straight through in the corridor. Opens the face and runs it to third man
length and angled down leg side, deflected off the thigh guard, past the keeper and into the fine leg fence
back of a length, nicely onto the bat in the corridor. Pushed on the rise to short extra cover
back of a length, nips back in sharply and strikes him on the thigh guard on his back leg. Off the inside edge. The appeal is turned down
back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
back of a length, moves in off the seam and takes the inside edge as he looks to slash this. Onto his front shin
back of a length, angles in and holds it's line in the air, before nipping off the pitch and jamming between bat and thigh guard as he fends
good length, in the corridor, left alone
full outside off stump, half-stride as he punches at it. Fielded by a diving cover
back of a length outside off, chopped to third man with no feet
good length, slight swing in at off stump, but he's solidly behind this. Pushes to mid-on
back of a length outside off stump, nudged to third man off the outer half
back of a length outside off, fends away from the body and gets an inside edge into the leg side
plumb. A poor shot. Swipes across the line for one of his signature pick-up shots, but he's right in front as this length ball angles in off the seam. Knee height impact, no doubt at all
back of a length at middle stump, defended with soft hands
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length, angled across the corridor, defended to point off the back foot
length, off stump, solidly defended into the off side
full at off stump, slight shape away. Pushed to mid-on
slower ball, out the back of the hand. Good length outside off. Defends to point
good length, shape away in the corridor, pushed to mid-off from the crease

edged and bisects keeper and slip. Some swing away from outside off stump, he slashes away from the body. The slip is wide. Sarfraz sticks his left hand out and withdraws. That's years of being next to a conventional slip acting. He should have gone for that
nicely played. Overpitched outside off, all balance as he caresses this past extra cover
back of a length, in at off stump. Defended into the off side. Kept low that one
back of a length at leg stump, easily on the back foot to flick this to fine leg
good length, tails in before pitching. He's forced to close the face and nudge this to midwicket
back of a length outside off, carved to third man
back of a length, angled wide outside off. Shapes up to play the cut but this skids through from under his bat
good length at off stump, solidly behind to tap this into the off side
full at middle stump. Looks to flick this but adjusts for the angle and feebly taps into the leg side. He would have been late on that shot, good call

full and angling down leg. He can't get bat on this as he looks to flick. Big appeal from the bowler as he's looking at the umpire....and a face that indicates it was nowhere near when he faces his skipper
back of a length at off stump, zips back in and hits him high on the pad. Late on that Tharanga. He doesn't look solid so far
back of a length, angled in at off stump, then straightening. Tharanga looked to poke at it and then withdrew
oh lovely. Back of a length in the corridor, teases him with the angle, makes him play, then beats the outside edge
good length in the corridor, anxiously defended off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side. Great over from Raees. Tharanga survives
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length, slightly wider outside off and angled away. Pokes away from the body and gets a thick inside edge
good length at leg stump, thuds him on the pad as he looks to flick. Two sounds there, and pitching outside edge. Appeal turned down
back of a length in the corridor, anxiously poked into the off side. No feet
good length outside off stump, pushed to mid-off on the up
full and in at leg stump, watchfully pushed to mid-on
back of a length at off stump, dropped into the pitch off the back foot
chips it wide of mid-on. In control of this. This is full on middle stump and he brings the full face down o it before using his wrists to get it wide
back of a length outside off stump, defended to point from the crease
140 kph, back of a length, angled away in the corridor. Defended off the back foot
134 kph, back of a length on the pads. Tactfully poked through square leg, comes back for the second as midwicket and fine leg converge
back of a length in the corridor, tapped into the covers on the up
back of a length, shaping away off the pitch. Squares him up as he defends

big appeal for lbw. This full ball hit him in front of middle stump as he was looking to flick. He's over the wicket, so the umpire must think it pitched outside. Given not out. Pakistan have reviewed. Ultra Edge shows no inside edge....and tracking shows the ball pitched outside. Decision stands. Pakistan lose their review.
back of a length at off stump, nervous prod at it again. Ball hits bat, on the inside half
good length at middle stump, no feet as he flicks straight to midwicket
good length at middle stump, closes the face, pushes to midwicket
good length, angled across off stump. Big inside edge onto pad as he looks to flick
good length at off stump, pushed down to long-on
back of a length outside off, defended into the off side off the outer half
back of a length at off stump, tapped to extra cover on the up
good length at middle stump, tucked off the pads to deep square
good length, slider at middle stump. Goes deep in the crease and flicks it very very late

was that an edge? A sound as Tharanga looks to slash at this length ball outside off. But it could have just been the ball smashing in Sarfraz's glove. He didn't gather it...yes, there was an edge. It's a dropped chance.
back of a length in the corridor, holds its line after pitching. Defended into the off side
bouncer, too short for him to hit. He ducks it
back of a length outside off, left alone
yorker just outside off stump, tapped back down the pitch

and he gets him to hole out to deep square! Hasan Ali is screaming, as he runs past Mendis with his arms outstretched. A perfectly directed short ball, climbs on Mendis who ducked it last time, but was probably riled up by the words before the ball. Takes it on and top-edges it. Deep square had to run in a fair bit, but it was easy in the end
143 kph, angled across off stump. Gets deep in the crease and defends this
good length at off stump, pushed down the pitch off the front foot
good length, drifted in at off stump. Defends it in the air as this stops on him

dropped! Shadab Khan puts down a simple one at extra cover. Tharanga steps out premeditatedly and isnt't to the pitch as this spins away from him. Pokes. Chips in the air. Shadab grabs to his left and puts it down
back of a length outside off, poked through the covers
good length at leg stump, pushed into the leg side
good length at off stump, deflected past slip off the outside half of the bat
back of a length in the corridor, defended very late, towards the slip cordon
141 kph, back of a length at middle stump, poked into the leg side
good length, angled across off stump. Guided down to third man
140 kph, full at off stump. Defended into the covers

only Tharanga could have played this shot today. Plenty of luck for him to still be there. This one is short and angled into him. He withdraws the bat and drops his wrist to try and let it go. It follows him and hits the edge of the bat for a boundary to fine leg
full at middle stump, defended off the bottom of the bat
tossed up at off stump, defended into the off side
good length, skids in at middle stump. Backs away and taps it hurriedly into the off side
length at off stump, pushed through the covers
length, midlde stump, defended down the pitch
good length at the pads, flicked wide of short fine
good length at off stump, defended to extra cover
full at off stump. Tapped back at the bowler who throws it back at the stumps and makes him scramble
143 kph, back of a length outside off, climbs nastily above the bat as he looks to slash this square
121 kph, slower ball, back of a length outside off. Sliced down to third man
short ball outside off stump, batsman happy to leave. Hasan stares him down, then points at the square leg boundary to say 'why don't you hit it there?'
another bouncer, this one angled down leg and left alone again
141 kph, back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side with a lose grip
good length, angled in at off stump. Flicked wide of mid-on with a turning bat
tossed up outside off, steps out and yorks himself. Pokes it to extra cover
tossed up at off stump, pushed to extra cover's left
beats the outside edge. Backs away as he looks to cut this back of a length ball
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length at off stump, spins away as he looks to make room. It's too far in the end and he has to check his punch
back of a length outside off, pushed to point's left...he never had a chance, but Sarfraz doesn't agree as he hands him a public shouting
good length, angled in at leg stump. Tucked through square leg off the back foot
good length at off stump, pushed down the pitch off the inside half of the bat
good length, angled in at leg stump. Poked to midwicket

dropped at first slip. Babar Azam is woken up by a ball flying in his direction. Get away, Sarfraz is a metre to your right.Tossed up outside off, goes for the big drive but this dips and takes the outside edge. Waist height into the body, poor effort
short and wide outside off, makes too much room but adjusts to ramp this past slip. Short third man gives a long chase and pulls it back with a slide
good length, sliding into and thudding the pads as he looks to flick. He was on the back foot, the ball was sliding down
quick on the pads to start, nudged to midwicket
some spin, tosses this one up fuller outside off, carved off the open face to point
poor shot. Quick and straight, Tharanga opens his stance and guides a push to point, took the ball off middle stump
full, flight on off, a bit of a leading edge back to the bowler. Fantastic accuracy from Hafeez
that will do nothing for Sarfraz's tranquility. Flat on middle and leg, inside-edged towards short fine leg, where a single is conceded. Sarfraz sedately disappointed
quick and straight, driven to long-on. That one didn't turn, which was why he drove that to long-on, instead of long-off.
nice loop and drift on middle and off, pushed with soft hands towards point for a quick run. Well played
quick and full around off, 92 kph, driven to cover.
nicely bowled, Malik's pace is slower than Hafeez's, which means the stock ball will be the one that turns slightly, like this one. Patted away
this one is quicker and doesn't turn. Quick down leg, off the pad towards short fine leg
pushed through. No turn again. Quick on leg, hits bTharanga flush in front of leg but that angle is taking it down leg. A big appeal, a quick no from the umpire
the line is bad, short down leg, Tharanga misses his pull, off the pad down to fine leg for some runs
why? Another poor shot. Quick and straight, Hafeez doesn't turn many. This one drifts towards middle, and Thirimanne takes it off the stumps, drives to cover
nice use of the feet, gets close to the pitch and drives to the sweeper cover
80 kph, nicely played again. Gets forward and drives past cover for one to the sweeper cover
82 kph, quick on off, cut to point, another iffy stroke. A matter of time before he misses one
read the length early, picked the right shot but failed to execute. Short on off, short enough for Thirimanne to go back and try to pull over midwicket, but he can only mis-time the ball to long-on
quick outside off, cut into the off side, towards point. Fine bowling from these offspinners
a manufactured run. Short and straight, Thirimanne goes back and clatters a cut to deep point. It's a very risky shot
oh yeaaah! That's not risky, that's classy. Flight outside off, very wide. Tharanga leans forward and caresses his cover drive over cover. It was what he was attempting when he was dropped
quick outside off, driven to cover with the spin. Good options these
shortish and wide, some turn, carved to third man. Some spin.

given by umpire Shozab Raza. But Tharanga reviews immediately. There was a noise, which forced Sarfraz's massive appeal. The umpire was influenced by the noise and the appeal. Is there an edge? The bat definitely hits the back pad, but does the ball hit the bat too? I don't think. 'There was nothing on Ultra Edge, the bat hit the pad,' says the third umpire S Ravi. Sarfraz didn't mind giving Tharanga an angry send-off, but has nothing to say now. Wow, how things change. Good review

take that, says Tharanga. Short on middle and off, Tharanga picks the length early, goes back and pulls well over midwicket, picked his area, the ball lands in front of the boundary and then into the boundary cushion. Fantastic shot.
flat outside off, guided away towards point
slow and short and wide, slapped in front of cover for a run
quick down leg, 92 kph, strays down leg. Well taken by Sarfraz but wide
nicely stopped from Shadab. Short and wide, carved to point. Good stop
fine. Using the pace. Short outside off, lets the ball come to him before guiding a late cut past short third man for runs
nicely bowled, some flight on middle, driven towards cover, where Shehzad dives to his left to save one
almost got through. Not sure why Thirimanne thinks this is a high-percentage shot. Short and straight, no turn, drifts on towards off, he cuts off the stumps to point.
quick on off, 87 kph, pushed to point. A better shot, played that square with as straight a bat as possible
that is not a good shot. Quick on off, the ball slides on and just misses the front pad en route to the angled bat, to short third man. If it hits the front pad, that's out
flight outside off, chipped over the infield, for one to the sweeper cover
94 kph, quick outside off, Thirimanne misses a deft late cut. Almost hit off stump. A lbw or bowled is not too far away

well, it's here. Umpire Raza gives Thirimanne, but he reviews. Flight on leg, Thirimanne gets low for a slog sweep, but doesn't make any contact. He is struck right in front of leg, the ball drifts on and HawkEye suggests the ball is clipping the outside of leg stump. Not a bad review, Sri Lanka don't lose their review, but lose Thirimanne, whose shot selection through his innings was frankly dire.
quick on leg from around the wicket, worked to deep square leg. A fumble from the fielder allows the second. Sarfraz is ready to take his bat, ball and stumps and walk home. He's seething.
85 kph, flight on off, defended. Sri Lanka need to just relax, they have been overly frantic, when they don't need to be
quick on the pads, worked towards midwicket, who dives to his left to save a run
drifts down leg for a wide
quick on middle, low bounce, pushed back to the bowler. Playing with the full face, well done
84 kph, shortish outside off. Short enough for Tharanga to go back and cut to deep cover
tossed up outside off, worked with the spin to midwicket
short outside off, spinning in, worked with the spin to square leg. Tidy over
nice start from Shadab, quick outside off, spinning back in, worked back
the quicker one, may have been the googly, nudged to midwicket

that's a fine shot. Against the legspin, that's not a bad shot because the pace is slower. Short on off, Tharanga picks the length early, goes back and slashes a cut through backward point. Superb execution. Sarfraz not pleased again. He is now chatting with Shadab.
lots of flight outside off, 86 kph, driven to long-off

the googly, Chandimal did not pick that. Wow, massive bat-pad gap, and Shadab finds it. Makes a quality batsman look rather foolish. Discernibly released from the back of the hand, but Chandimal can't see that because he is seeing the front of the hand, it's beautifully pitched - flight, loop on off, which invites Chandimal into a drive. Big gap and the ball creeps through to knock into middle stump
the legbreak to start to Siriwardana, attacking the stumps. Worked with the spin to midwicket
the slider again, quick on middle and leg, off the inside edge to square leg
quick on the pads, flicked past short midwicket for a couple. Sarfraz not happy again
bunted back to the bowler. slower through the air, Siriwardana quick through the shot, lucky it lands in front
quick outside off, cut to the sweeper cover for one
pushed through again. Quick outside off, skids on, blocked back
another slider. Really quick, driven back to the bowler rather awkwardly

taken this time by Babar. Sri Lanka's struggles to wristspin not different from the rest of the world. Siriwardana, this time, doesn't pick the googly, goes back and prods very conscious of the ball going through bat and pad, but it's not the legbreak. And Siriwardana has no clue. He is a good enough batsman to adjust and get close to the ball, but that's very risky in international cricket, the ball takes the outside edge and carries to Babar at waist height, to his left. I can say that he should play the line and allow himself to be beaten on the outside edge, but that's not easy at all. Fantastic delivery
flight on off, worked back to the bowler
lovely timing. Lots of flight outside off, too full, driven past cover for three. Fantastic timing. Sarfraz has a frown again, shocking.
the googly on middle, nudged to fine leg. Sarfraz is having a go at his bowler again. Unique leadership, whatever works right?
85 kph, sublime timing. Overpitched flight outside off, Thisara leans on his drive and caresses the ball through mid-off and cover. The legbreak is suppressed
quick outside off, 88 kph, pushed to cover from the back foot.
short on leg, worked to Imad at midwicket for a quick single

taken again. Sri Lanka are falling away. The umpires want to check if Babar has taken the catch. Babar certainly thinks he has. The soft signal is out. Beautiful bowling that, slow and loopy outside off. Thisara wafts, and the ball takes the outside edge. Travels low to Babar, whose hands are in the wrong position, the ball hits the wrist and the high part of the hand, but the ball ricochets back into his body, and he somehow wrangles his body into a position to take the catch via the thigh and the leg and the arm and whatnot. Pakistan don't care how.
quick on leg, worked to midwicket, the slider.
another one that drifts on. Quick on middle and leg, the ball skids on and hits Tharanga in front of leg
flight outside off, 80 kph, carved away to point
nice end. Quick and straight, pushed to cover. 'Very well bowled Hafeez bhai,' goes Sarfraz. He is not wrong at all

another one! Seven down now Sri Lanka. As a tail-ender, against wristspin, you always have to be wary of the delivery that attacks the stumps  - the legbreak to the left-hander and the googly to the right-hander. Dananjaya is a left-hander, but is not aware enough that Shadab will attack the stumps, because there are more modes of dismissals available. He goes back, misses the legbreak and the ball sneaks through to hit the stumps.
it's full, straight. Smothered. Couldn't see what variation that was, sorry.
that is the legbreak, short and wide outside off, Vandersay misses a cut
lots of flight outside off, 86 kph, driven away towards cover
lots of flight again on off, driven to mid-off for one
the legbreak again, outside off, spinning in, worked back to the bowler
flight on off, 84 kph, worked with the spin to midwicket
fired in on off, no turn, shovelled to midwicket
much slower through the air, on off, defended
quick down leg, worked away towards square leg
quick outside off, outside-halved towards cover
24 off his 10 overs. Fantastic spell from Hafeez. Quick down leg, worked away towards square leg to retain strike
the googly outside off, clattered to the sweeper cover from the back foot
big appeal. No, says umpire Raza. Quick on middle, Tharanga misses a flick and is struck in front of middle and leg. Probably spinning down. No, three reds says HawkEye

fine shot to get to a fine fifty. Flight outside off, the ball spinning in, Tharanga gets under the length and lifts the ball over mid-off. He had to stay slightly inside the line to hit the ball against the spin, expertly done
worked away past midwicket for a run to deep midwicket
flight outside off, 87 kph, driven to long-off with the spin
quick on off, carved away towards third man. Can't retain strike
shortish delivery outside off, chopped away towards gully
131 kph, good length delivery outside off, defended into the off side
full on middle and leg, 129 kph, worked away to mid-on
a very short bouncer loops over Vandersay's duck. Wide called
shortish and wide, 134 kph, sliced to third man
short delivery outside off, 128 kph, Tharanga thinks of playing, but bails out
another short delivery, intentionally bowled to prevent Tharanga from playing a stroke to keep strike. Tharanga reaches out for it, but misses.
129 kph, on a length down leg, worked to deep square leg for one
whacked over midwicket. Slightly short on middle, Tharanga reads the length and picks his shot, a heave over midwicket. Mid-on was up, safe shot.
full delivery outside off, drilled to mid-off, who dives to his left but fumbles, conceding the run
good length delivery, honing in on off, inside-edged towards fine leg
short outside off, loops over the attempted upper cut by Tharanga
smashed again. Deep square leg gets across to cut it in. Shortish on leg, swung away over midwicket
good length on middle and leg, the ball seaming back in, worked to midwicket

just short of deep square leg. Fantastic effort from Shehzad, runs in and looks to take the catch, but the ball juuust about carried, or lands juuust in front. If that landed a foot in front, his teeth were in trouble. A nice short delivery on leg, pulled to square leg
slower ball on middle and leg, played away to midwicket
137 kph, on a length around off, played into the off side towards cover
good length delivery on middle and leg, 117 kph, clipped to square leg
back of a length on leg, some zippy pace and troublesome bounce. Awkwardly fended back

short but drifts down leg. Goes through Sarfraz's legs. One run given? Bad call, no bat, no pad. Should have been two. There was bat, says UltraEdge, so fantaaaastic decision from the umpire. So that counts as a drop, another one off Tharanga
the googly, on off, worked to midwicket
the legbreak, quick outside off. Zips past Vandersay's bat
gets this past point for a couple. Flight outside off, sliced past point
driven with the spin to cover
looked like the googly, on off, driven back to the bowler
a yorker on middle, 135 kph, worked to midwicket for one. Tharanga trusting his partner
another fine yorker, on off, jammed out
135 kph, good length on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
131 kph, another well-directed bouncer down leg, off the glove towards fine leg. Hustled him for pace, skiddy guy Hasan
another short delivery outside off, 126 kph, Tharanga bails out of a stroke again. Hasan has used the short ball extremely well so far
and another bouncer, Tharanga gets underneath.
short and wide, spinning a long way. Beaten on the cut
back of a length at off stump, thick outside edge as he pokes at this
good length outside off stump, draws him forward and beats the outside edge
googly, pitches on middle and catches him on the pad. Going down leg though

big appeal from Pakistan as Vandersay chases this length ball outside off. They clearly think there's an edge. Umpire thinks he was only comprehensively beaten. Shadab gestures in frustration at the umpire. That could be demerit points...Ultra Edge show there was an edge
back of a length at off stump, turned into the leg side off the back foot
slower ball, back of a length in the corridor. Waits for it to arrive and dabs it to third man
back of a length at leg stump, tickled to deep square
back of a length outside off. Backs away and looks to thump it wide of mid-off, but toe-ends it to the fielder instead
back of the hand slower ball, good length and wide outside off. He backs away and then is forced to lunge at it. Beaten
great shot. Full one at off, and now we know why he kept backing away. No one deep in the off side. Makes room, gets under it and uses his wrists to dispatch this to the cover boundary
good length, angled in at middle. Looks to turn it into the leg side, but cops it on the pad
good length outside off, chases away from the body and bunts it to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, looks to turn it into the leg side but can't get enough power on it as this spins away from him
full toss outside off stump, driven to long-off
flat one, back of a length at off stump. Makes room but can't beat point with the cut. Was falling over as he played this
good length at middle stump, flicked past the bowler to long-on
googly, slides through and cramps him down leg side as he backs away to play the cut. Slices it weakly to point
slower ball, short and wide outside off stump. There is a deep fielder at cover this time, but he has so much time that he can slap this to the extra cover boundary
slower ball again, this is an offcutter. Spins back in and cuts out the room as he looks to dab it down to third man
offcutter, back of a length at leg stump. Pushes it through midwicket with soft hands and allows them to come back for the second

offcutter, back of a length outside off. Dabs it to short third man, looks at his partner who says okay. Runs through for a single that was never there, but Fakhar Zaman can't hit the stumps at the strikers end
good length, angled in at leg stump, flicked to deep square
offuctter, good length at off stump, shovelled to mid-off with his wrists
back of a length at leg stump, goes well into the off side but cuts it straight to point as this spins back in
good length at leg stump, gets down and places this sweep well to deep square's left. That fielder was in ten yards and he can't get across to cut it
shot! He's been waiting so long for that room. Gets it now. Tossed up outside off, he gets close enough to cut out any spin and slashes it wide of sweeper cover
back of a length outside off stump, punched to sweeper cover's left and they steal the second run
good length at leg stump, flicked past midwicket
googly, good length outside off stump. It's picked by the opposition legspinner, who flicks this down to long-on
good length, tailing in at off stump. Big forward stride as he defends this into the off side
back of a length outside off, looks to poke it into the off side, but there's some late movement and he can only get the inside half on this
good length at middle stump, pushed wide of midwicket
good length, angled in at the pads. Pokes it between deep midwicket and long-on to come back for an easy second
good length, angled into the pads again. Flicks this with more power than before, hits it straight to deep midwicket
short on at off stump, defended off the back foot
oh this is brilliant from Tharanga. Tossed up full at leg stump, he waits and waits before picking the gap between long-on and deep midwicket perfectly
good length, pitches on leg stump, spins further down. Sarfraz parries it to short fine
good length at leg stump, poked to short fine's right
slider, back of a length at middle stump. Gets on the back foot to try and cut, but he's cramped and can't get it more than pitch side
short and just outside off stump, backs away and nails the cut to find sweeper cover
good length at leg stump, dropped into the leg side with soft hands
slider, back of a length at middle stump, deep in the crease to whip this to long-on
back of a length, nips in from outside off and it's too quick for the No. 9. He fends at it and doesn't know where it is. It's lodged behind the flap on his right pad
leading edge flies past backward point. He's looking to turn this into the leg side from outside off and closes the face too early
short ball outside off stump, stylish looking pull shot into the floor, but it's straight to midwicket
full and straight, angled in, but the full face of the bat comes out and it's a single down to long-on
yorker at off stump, Tharanga looks to work this through midwicket, but he can only hit it onto pad
Misses his length on the yorker. It's full on the pads and he nurdles it comfortably to long-on
slower ball, full outside off stump. Driven straight to extra cover
slower ball, short and in the corridor. Backs away and ramps this. Can only find third man on the bounce
back of a length at the pads, tickled to fine leg
short one, slow and rising at the helmet. Can't get power on the pull shot. Finds deep square

finds deep square leg! Is that it for Sri Lanka? Bouncer gets too big for Vandersay. He gets well under it as he goes after it with the hook. Can't blame him, the runs hadn't come this over. Finds Shehzad who pedals backwards and holds on well
back of a length, angled into the pads. Tucked through midwicket from the crease
glorious shot, but it's only one. Nice overpitched ball outside off, creamed along the floor to find sweeper
back of a length, angled in at the pads. He swivels to pull this, inside edges on to the front pad and responds to the call for a run

oh dear! Tharanga has got his hundred, but Lakmal might well be out attempting a poor second run. Length ball at middle stump, Tharanga tucked it in front of square leg. Lakmal turns after reaching the crease and takes off without waiting for a call. It takes him a long time to turn around and return and his dive is not good enough. He's out. The throw was slightly wide, but there was enough time
good length outside off, nice flowing square drive, but he finds point with it
back of a length at off stump, drops it into the off side and takes off....once again there's no run. But this earns him an overthrow as he runs back towards the crease
short one at off stump, a laboured pull, harmless, straight to long-on
back of a length at leg stump, flicked through square leg
back of a length at leg stump, defended into the leg side
good length, angled in at leg stump. Pushed wide of midwicket

back of a length, angled down leg side. He looks to whip it square. Appeal is turned down. But wide not given. Perhaps it was thigh guard. Or it could be bat, but the rule today is Tharanga can't be given out
slower ball, short and down leg side. Through the pull too early but the top-edge lands in front of Junaid at short fine. His dive isn't good enough
good length at off stump, awkwardly pushed into the off side
slower ball, short and wide outside off. No pace on it, he can only chip it over mid-off
yorker outside off stump, tapped into the off side
overpitched wide outside off, backs away and chops this to third man's left
shot. Short and just outside off stump, contorts to make room and slice this over extra cover to find the boundary
full at off stump, makes room, drives it straight to mid-off

this could be the end. Full toss outside off stump, sliced behind point and he comes back for the second. It appears to be a direct hit...but it also appears like Sarfraz might have broken the stumps with glove before the direct hit. It's a matter of three frames. Sarfraz's left glove touches the bails, but they're not off. In the next frame too the bails are on...also in the third frame! Which means the bails coming off in the fourth frame are because of the ball! That's it. Pakistan have finished this.
